cyclone.name: HARVEY
cyclone.current_location: about 250 miles SE of Corpus Christi, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest toward the middle Texas coast, then forecast to slow and meander near or just inland before drifting east-northeast along the upper Texas coast toward the Galveston area.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Rockport/Port O’Connor, TX (middle Texas coast)

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch and Storm-Surge Watch south of Port Mansfield TX to the Mouth of the Rio Grande; Tropical Storm Watch south of the Mouth of the Rio Grande to Boca de Catan, Mexico
weather_observation.warning_coast: Storm Surge Warning Port Mansfield to High Island TX; Hurricane Warning Port Mansfield to Sargent TX; Tropical Storm Warning north of Sargent to High Island TX and south of Port Mansfield to the Mouth of the Rio Grande
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Texas coast, especially the middle and upper sections from Port Mansfield through High Island, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds are likely (80% chance) with a 39% chance of 50-kt gusts; occasional hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2 to 4 ft of inundation possible around Galveston Bay, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 15–25 inches of rain possible with locally higher totals, creating life-threatening and prolonged flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Friday into Saturday; dangerous surf and rip currents.
